arm_group.description: interscalene brachial plexus block was preoperative performed 30 ml 0.5 % bupivacaine and after surgery 2 ml 8 mg dexamethasone  administration for intraarticular
interscalene brachial plexus was preoperative performed  30 ml 0.5 % bupivacaine added 2 ml 8mg dexamethasone

brief_summary.textblock:
the aim of this study was to investigate the analgesic efficacy of intra articular
      dexamethasone  administration for arthroscopic shoulder surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analgesic Effect of Intra-articular Dexamethasone and Dexamethasone Added to Bupivacaine in Interscalene Brachial Plexus

detailed_description.textblock:
shoulder surgery  can be very painful and interscalene brachial plexus block  is the gold
      standard in the management of acute pain after shoulder surgery. various local anaesthetic
      mixtures can be used to prolong local anaesthesia duration and epinephrine , opioids and
      dexamethasone are frequently  used for this purpose. dexamethasone has also been found the
      prolong the duration of lidocaine axillary blocks and intravenous regional anaesthesia.
      intraarticular administration of medicines  can be used for management of joint pain and
      opioids , local anaesthetics and dexamethasone are used for this purpose.In addition, there
      are no studies available to compare the different treatment methods used in clinical
      practice directly.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  between 18-65 years

          -  arthroscopic shoulder surgery

          -  no known allergies to drugs

          -  ASA 1-2 patients

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  history of diabetes

          -  history of chronic pain treatment

          -  pregnancy

          -  severe bronchopulmonary disease

          -  systemic glucocorticoid use

intervention.description: 2ml 8 mg dexamethasone administration interscalene brachial plexus added 30 ml 0.5 % bupivacaine

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4 Study of Comparison of Postoperative Analgesic Effect of Intra-articular Dexamethasone and Dexamethasone Added to Bupivacaine in Interscalene Brachial Plexus Blockade for Arthroscopic Shoulder Surgery

primary_outcome.description: morphine consumption (patient controlled analgesia procedure) was recorded

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Visual analog scale on rest and movement was recorded

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
